title: FundTrack - Approve Before Spend
description: Donors, UN & NGOs receive accounts after funds are spent, when the horse is out of the barn. Leaving them few options to control RoI.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal helps to create an accountability measure for Catalyst proposal.  This will help to create measures in place to release funds after milestones are met and to keep projects integrity and progress on track.  This would help to scale to all projects and minimize the chances of Catalyst being abused by bad actors
f6_assessments.q1: The team appears to have the relevant experience to build an auditing and accountability system.  The detailed nature of this write up displays their knowledge of accounting systems, Cardano technology, and the catalyst system.  The timeline and amount requested to accomplish this feat may sound tight as this is utilizing new technology like Atala.  There should be some contingencies built in to ensure that the plan is managed in the case bumps in the road are hit.
f6_assessments.q2: The project has very detailed plans on what they're trying to accomplish plush, but the roadmap isn't clearly defined of their own success measures.  Due to the nature and goals of this project, the success measures and roadmap are probably defined, just not mentioned here and could probably be generated easily.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal speaks amply on how this idea is a good idea and about its goals. However, very little is said how these goals are to be achieved. It speaks about many different ways to increase auditability of projects such as verifying expenditures before sending the money however there is no clear plan how to achieve this. There is no breakdown for the $50,000 being requested. Normally, authorities giving away grants have a case officer which would be responsible for a number of projects and he would be making up reports at various intervals. Furthermore, there is no link between the project and Cardano and solutions mentioned can be applied for any project evaluation entity. No guidance of how the process would be implement for Catalyst is given. All in all some useful information but nothing conclusive.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer is an entrepreneur. His experience in the matter seems to derive from applications made from his own businesses for funding from UN. No clear understanding of what the success of this project looks like.
f6_assessments.q2: If goals are not defined, these cannot be audited. You cannot asses the success of a project which does not have pre defined goals.

f6_assessments.q0:
The problem and solution described are not within the scope of the challenge. The premise of the challenge is to improve Catalyst's auditability and the rationale presented is not addressing Catalyst.

There is no structured implementation plan. The proposal reads like a rationale related to the accounting of UN SDG Projects, but it is very vague.

I would recommend using the Catalyst documentation as a template to craft a new proposal and submit it to an appropriate challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal is a draft. There is no implementation plan for, therefore it does not indicate feasibility. I would recommend using the Catalyst documentation as a template to craft a new proposal, add items related to feasibility such as roadmap, details about the team's qualification+sources, budget breakdown and submit the proposal to an appropriate challenge
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal is a draft. There is no implementation plan for, therefore it does not indicate auditability. I would recommend using the Catalyst documentation as a template to craft a new proposal, add items related to auditability such as roadmap, details about the team's qualification+sources, budget breakdown, metric,  KPIs and submit the proposal to an appropriate challenge

f6_assessments.q0: The project proposed sounds like a good addition to increase auditability of projects. Since the proposal is a bit disorganized and lacking some formal pretequisites only 4 stars.
f6_assessments.q1: There is no real execution plan presented and no milestones given. The team does not properly introduce themselves. No rationale for the budget is given. Which is a shame, because clearly some thought has been pit into the proposal. I hope you take a look at successful proposals and what they require and try again next time.
f6_assessments.q2: While the product is explained so at least the delivery of the end product can be audited, the lack of a timeline, milestones, KPIs and specified costs for different tasks will make auditing really hard.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal addresses the problem at hand. As the problem is to easily audit, evaluate and keep track of projects being implemented and also  how funds are being used. The proposal seek to keep track of the how funds are being used in terms of transactions made to implement proposals or undertake projects  but it has  not stated clearly how it is going to keep track of the impacts of projects undertaken that is if the project undertaken or implemented is serving it course.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer or team has provided us with videos and attached files showing evidently his involvement is the  blockchain networking community and also a defined contract schema and some necessary files indicating that the project is ongoing but however the proposer or team has not indicated the type and number of team members if it is a team effort of individual effort and also there isn't a break down on how the fund requested is going to be used. f6_assessments.q2: The proposal clearly stated how the problem can be address using the FundTrack app but how ever a step-by-step plan for the implementation with clearly defined time horizon is not available. Even though the project is on going a clear metrics of the success rate must be provides. Also a clearly defined metrics on how budget is going to be used indicating that the projects can be audited when implemented
